SENT.plain: Cocaine causes serious neurologic and neuropsychiatric complications
Cocaine-induced seizures are common and appear to be due to the local anaesthetic actions of this compound
Cocaine induced stroke has varied mechanisms
With ischemic stroke there is severe vasospasm induced by rises in brain catecholamines
These changes can persist for many weeks and can be demonstrated using single-photon emission computerized tomography (SPECT)
In many patients with psychiatric symptoms such as psychosis or mania, SPECT demonstrates similar changes in cerebral blood flow
In fact, some of the psychiatric symptoms induced by cocaine may be due to decreases in cerebral blood flow
In cocaine abuse, treatment strategies based on decreasing cerebral vasospasm need to be developed
